summary: A forum featuring candidates for County Commissioner discussing key issues and their platforms.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a blue and green gradient background featuring a hexagonal pattern, transitioning to a title screen that reads "COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM" in bold white letters on a blue background, flanked by two stars. The text "Sponsored by..." appears above the logos of "The Kent Island Bay Times" and "Record Observer," followed by "Produced by..." and the logo of "QACTV.COM." The scene then shifts to a woman with curly blonde hair, wearing a black top and a necklace with a cross pendant, seated at a table with a blue and white background. The text "HANNAH COMBS" and "Bay Times & Record Observer" appears at the bottom of the screen. The video then shows a man in a suit and tie seated across from her, with the same background and the "COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM" logo displayed on a screen behind them. The video concludes with a close-up of the man, who is wearing a lapel pin and a microphone, with his hands clasped on the table.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a female voice stating the conditions for the candidates' participation, explaining the source of the video and the questions. Then, another female voice introduces a man, Jim, who is the incumbent County Commissioner at large, and a Republican candidate, then welcomes him. A male voice responds, thanking the speaker.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal discussion between two individuals seated at a round table in a studio setting. The backdrop displays a screen with the text "QUEEN ANNE'S COUNTY COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM," indicating the context of the conversation. The woman, dressed in a black top, and the man, wearing a dark suit with a light purple tie, engage in a dialogue, with the man gesturing as he speaks. The camera alternates between close-ups of each participant, highlighting their expressions and gestures. The background includes a modern, geometric design with a blue and white color scheme. The discussion appears to be part of a televised forum, as suggested by the professional setting and the presence of a logo for "MyEasternShoreMD" on the screen, which is a local news outlet. The atmosphere is serious and focused, with both individuals maintaining a composed demeanor throughout the exchange.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio starts with a female speaker asking someone if they could take a couple of minutes to talk about themselves and why they like to continue serving as County Commissioner. A male speaker responds stating that he has been a resident of the county for 15 years and mentions some background about his family. He goes on to say that he was first appointed to the position five years ago, then won the election four years ago. He says he wants to continue in that position for four more years, then lists some benefits of his service as a county commissioner. The male speaker expresses a tone of pride and confidence about his achievements. The clip ends with him saying the county is in great shape and that he's looking to do even bigger and better things in the next four years.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a professional interview setting with two individuals seated at a round table. The woman, dressed in a black top and adorned with a necklace, is actively engaged in conversation, using hand gestures to emphasize her points. The man, wearing a dark suit with a light purple tie, listens attentively and occasionally responds, also using hand gestures. The background displays a screen with the text "Production by... QACTV.COM PUBLIC INFORMATION | TELEVISION | WEBSITE," indicating the production company behind the video. The atmosphere is formal and focused, with both participants appearing engaged in a serious discussion. The video transitions to show the screen displaying "Sponsored by... Bay Times Record Observer," suggesting sponsorship or partnership with these entities. The setting remains consistent throughout, with a modern and professional ambiance.
events_list.audio_caption: A female speaker, adopting a conversational tone, begins the clip by asking the other speaker about the biggest challenges facing the county. The male speaker, also speaking conversationally, answers by stating the biggest issue the county will face in the future is traffic, specifically beach traffic. He clarifies they do not have a traffic problem from November through April, but they do in the summertime.

events_list.video_caption: In a professional studio setting, a man and a woman are seated at a round table, engaged in a discussion. The man, dressed in a dark suit with a light purple tie, is identified as Jim Moran, the 2018 Republican Candidate for Commissioner At-Large, as indicated by the text overlay. He speaks animatedly, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. The woman, wearing a black top, listens attentively, occasionally responding. Behind them, a screen displays the text "Sponsored by... Bay Times Record Observer," suggesting the sponsorship of the event. The background features a modern, geometric design, contributing to the formal atmosphere of the interview. The camera focuses on the man, capturing his expressions and gestures as he elaborates on his campaign and vision.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the construction of a Delaware bypass that will connect to 301. He mentions a meeting with commissioners and the Economic Development Commission to discuss the traffic impacts on the county, emphasizing the long-term traffic concerns. The speaker's tone is informative and concerned.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal interview setting with two individuals seated at a round table. The man, dressed in a dark suit with a light purple tie, is actively gesturing with his hands while speaking, indicating he is explaining or emphasizing points. The woman, wearing a black top, listens attentively with her hands clasped on the table. Behind them, a large screen displays the text "QUEEN ANNE'S COUNTY COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM," suggesting the context of a political discussion or debate. The background consists of a modern, geometric design with a mix of white and black panels, contributing to a professional atmosphere. As the interview progresses, the screen changes to show the logo of "MyEasternShoreMD," indicating the media outlet covering the event. The man continues to speak, occasionally looking towards the woman, who remains engaged in the conversation. The overall setting is clean, organized, and focused on the discussion at hand.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with one male speaker, who states, "And we have been trying for the last three years with the state to give them solutions or options to help us with our traffic problem." He speaks in a conversational and informative tone. He continues to discuss the proposed solutions and options for addressing traffic issues, focusing on a recent proposal involving closing exits and monitoring others. The speaker emphasizes that the long-term goals are what they're working on now with the state, and that there will be a review process. There is a second female speaker, who simply states, "Okay."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a professional interview setting with two individuals seated at a round table. The woman, with curly blonde hair, is dressed in a black top and wears a cross necklace, while the man, identified as Jim Moran, is in a dark suit with a light purple tie. They are engaged in a conversation, with the man gesturing as he speaks and the woman listening attentively. The background consists of a modern, geometric-patterned wall, and a screen displays the text "Production by... QACTV.COM PUBLIC INFORMATION | TELEVISION | WEBSITE," indicating the production company. The atmosphere is formal and focused, with both participants appearing engaged in the discussion. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the two, highlighting their body language and expressions as they communicate.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a female speaker introducing the next segment: "We're going to move on to some questions we'd like you to answer in a minute." A male speaker responds affirmatively with "Okay." The female continues by stating that the comprehensive plan is coming up for review, and asks "What is your vision for that plan? How do you see that shaping?" The male then responds by stating that the current plan is "a fine plan" but that it just needs to be tweaked. He notes that the Tier system is something that needs to be considered now that it was not during the last plan. The male speaker mentions concerns with septic systems, flooding, and rising tides, which they need to account for with flood maps. He concludes with a summary, saying that those are the two major components they're going to have to look at with the existing comp plan to see how they can work those in there. The female speaker then replies, "Okay."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal interview setting with two individuals seated at a round table, engaged in a discussion. The woman, dressed in a black top, and the man, wearing a dark suit with a light-colored tie, are positioned opposite each other. The background includes a large screen displaying various texts, such as "Sponsored by Bay Times Record Observer," "QUEEN ANNE'S COUNTY COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM," and "MyEasternShoreMD," indicating the context of a political forum. The man is seen gesturing with his hands while speaking, and the woman listens attentively, occasionally responding. The setting is professional, with a modern design featuring a partition with square panels. The atmosphere is serious and focused, typical of a political discussion or interview. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the two individuals, highlighting their engagement in the conversation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker inquiring about strategies for addressing a request from the school system for funding. A male speaker responds, noting it's a core question for the county. He explains that he has funded the school board over maintenance of effort in the past, and suggests an outside agency to audit the school board's budget cycle to assess the true need. The female speaker responds with agreement. Another female speaker then begins speaking.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man and a woman are seated at a round table in a studio setting, engaged in a discussion. The woman, dressed in a black top, and the man, wearing a suit and tie, are positioned in front of a screen displaying the logo "MyEasternShoreMD" with the tagline "Powered by You and Their Publications." The man gestures with his hands as he speaks, while the woman listens attentively, occasionally responding with her own gestures. The background features a modern design with a blue and white color scheme, and the atmosphere appears professional and focused. The video transitions to a close-up of the woman, highlighting her expressions and gestures as she speaks. The screen behind them changes to display "Production by... QACTV.COM" with the tagline "Public Information | Television | Website," indicating the production company responsible for the video. The man continues to speak, using hand gestures to emphasize his points, while the woman listens and occasionally responds. The video maintains a consistent professional tone throughout, with the focus on the conversation between the two individuals.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a female speaker mentioning "some residents have concerns for balancing future development with protecting the environment". She asks "what is a suggestion for balancing those two?" A male speaker responds and clarifies they'll talk about future development, and says "I want to make it plain and clear to the public of Queen Annes County as."

events_list.video_caption: The video features a professional interview setting with two individuals seated at a round table. The person on the left, a woman with blonde hair, is dressed in a black dress and is attentively listening. The person on the right, a man wearing a dark suit, light pink shirt, and patterned tie, is actively speaking and gesturing with his hands. Behind them, a large screen displays various texts, including "Production by... QACTV.COM PUBLIC INFORMATION | TELEVISION | WEBSITE" and later "Sponsored by... Bay Times Record Observer." The background consists of a modern, partitioned wall with a mix of opaque and transparent panels, creating a formal and focused atmosphere. The man's gestures and the attentive posture of the woman suggest an engaging conversation, likely related to the man's candidacy for a political position, as indicated by the text overlay identifying him as "JIM MORAN 2018 Republican Candidate for Commissioner At-Large." The video maintains a consistent setting and tone throughout, emphasizing the interview's professional nature.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker defending himself against accusations, emphasizing that he's unjustly blamed for development projects. He claims he's a "whipping boy" and highlights that he has only voted on one development project in his role as commissioner. His tone is defensive and assertive. The speaker aims to correct what he believes is misinformation being spread publicly.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man in a suit and tie is seen sitting at a table, engaged in a conversation with a woman who is partially visible. The man is actively gesturing with his hands, indicating that he is explaining or emphasizing a point. He is wearing a dark suit, a light-colored shirt, and a patterned tie. The background features a modern, geometric design with a mix of light and dark panels, creating a professional atmosphere. On the screen behind them, the text "Sponsored by... Bay Times Record Observer" is displayed, suggesting that the discussion is part of a sponsored event or interview. The woman, dressed in a black outfit, listens attentively, with her hands resting on the table. The setting appears to be a studio or a formal meeting room, with a focus on the interaction between the two individuals. The video captures the dynamic exchange between the man and the woman, highlighting the man's expressive gestures and the attentive posture of the woman.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker, in a conversational tone, discussing the environment and how it relates to a "comp plan." He emphasizes the need to be prepared to examine "rising tides" and defines "conservation" as certain tracts of land being protected from development.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal interview setting with two individuals seated at a round table, engaged in a discussion. The person on the left, wearing a black dress, gestures with their hands while speaking, indicating active participation in the conversation. The person on the right, dressed in a dark suit with a light purple tie, listens attentively and occasionally responds, using hand gestures to emphasize points. The background includes a large screen displaying various texts, such as "Sponsored by Bay Times Record Observer," "QUEEN ANNE'S COUNTY COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM," and "MyEasternShoreMD," suggesting the context of a political forum or interview. The environment is professional, with a modern design featuring a grid-like partition and a teal accent wall. The atmosphere is serious and focused, typical of a formal interview or discussion. The video transitions smoothly between close-up shots of the individuals, highlighting their expressions and gestures, and wider shots that include the background screen, providing context to the discussion. The text on the screen changes to reflect different segments or sponsors of the event, maintaining a consistent theme of political discourse.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a conversational discussion about business growth and economic development. A male speaker addresses a question about fostering business growth in the county, emphasizing the opportunities along the 301 corridor, foreseeing a tripling of traffic and stating that a study has showed it. He mentions the need for high-speed internet or broadband for businesses, mentioning the names of Commissioner Jack Wilson and himself and expresses a desire to retain local talent and high-paying jobs by stopping residents from crossing the Bay Bridge for work. A female speaker briefly responds in agreement.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man and a woman are seated at a round table, engaged in a conversation. The woman, dressed in a black top, and the man, wearing a suit and tie, both have papers in front of them. They are in a studio setting with a large screen behind them displaying the text "MyEasternShoreMD" and "Powered by YOU and these Publications." The atmosphere is professional, and the individuals appear to be discussing a topic of interest. As the conversation progresses, the screen behind them changes to display "Production by... QACTV.COM" with the tagline "Public Information | Television | Website." The man and woman continue their discussion, with the man gesturing with his hands while speaking. The setting remains consistent throughout the video, with the focus on the interaction between the two individuals and the information displayed on the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker addressing concerns voiced by residents in the northern part of the county, mentioning that they sometimes feel they don't receive the same services as the rest of the county. The tone is conversational and inquisitive. A male speaker responds, stating he doesn't necessarily see that as far as services go. His tone is measured and thoughtful.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal interview setting with two individuals seated at a round table. The man, dressed in a dark suit with a light purple tie, is actively engaged in conversation, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. The woman, wearing a black dress, listens attentively, occasionally responding with her own gestures. The background consists of a modern, geometric design with a screen displaying various texts, including "Production by... QACTV.COM" and "Sponsored by... Bay Times Record Observer." The atmosphere is professional, with both participants focused on the discussion. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the interviewer and the interviewee, highlighting their expressions and gestures as they communicate.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a male speaker addressing a farming industry concern, emphasizing that their voice sometimes goes unheard, and mentioning a discussion on solar energy where some farmers opted to lease their farms. He assures them of his full support, acknowledges that they have distinct issues that need attention and says that he understands their issues. The clip transitions to a female speaker asking if there were any other untouched issues to discuss.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a formal interview setting with two individuals seated at a round table, engaged in a discussion. The person on the left, a woman with curly hair, is dressed in a black top and is attentively listening, while the person on the right, a man in a dark suit and tie, is actively speaking and gesturing with his hands. The background displays a screen with text that reads "Sponsored by... Bay Times Record Observer" and later changes to "QUEEN ANNE'S COUNTY COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM," indicating the context of the discussion. The environment is professional, with a modern design featuring a partition with square panels. The atmosphere is serious and focused, typical of a political or community forum. The man's gestures and expressions suggest he is explaining or emphasizing points during the conversation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker who sounds somewhat enthusiastic and confident introducing a topic. He highlights the importance of parks in Queen Anne's County and mentions a decision made three years ago. His tone is conversational. He describes the effort to bring existing parks "up to grade," including paving and marking parking lots, adding bathrooms and concession stands, and removing dead trees. He wants to enhance what they have because many families use the parks on weekends. He expresses pride in being the liaison to parks and rec.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a suit and tie, seated at a table, engaged in a conversation with a woman who is partially visible. The man is seen gesturing with his hands while speaking, indicating an active discussion. The background includes a screen displaying the logo "MyEasternShoreMD," which is powered by "YOU and these publications," suggesting a local news or community-focused program. The setting appears to be a professional studio with a modern design, featuring a partition with a geometric pattern. The atmosphere is formal and focused, with both individuals appearing attentive and engaged in the dialogue. The man's gestures and the woman's attentive posture suggest a dynamic exchange of ideas or information.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing "opioid awareness" and the work of the "drug-free coalition." He mentions the "Queen Anne's County going purple" initiative, praising its effectiveness in raising awareness and encouraging conversations. His tone is informative and positive.  The clip concludes with the speaker mentioning that they have been trying to accomplish this for three years.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a woman and a man seated at a round table, engaged in a conversation. The woman, dressed in a black dress, and the man, wearing a dark suit with a tie, are positioned in front of a screen displaying the logo "MyEasternShoreMD" with the tagline "Powered by YOU and these Publications." The setting appears to be a professional studio environment, with a modern and clean design. The scene transitions to a graphic with the text "COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM" in bold white letters on a blue background, indicating the topic of discussion. The video then shows additional graphics, including the text "Sponsored by..." followed by the logos of "The Kent Island Bay Times" and "Record Observer," and "Produced by..." with the logo of "QACTV.COM." The video concludes with a return to the "COMMISSIONER CANDIDATE FORUM" graphic, emphasizing the forum's focus on political candidates.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a brief conversation. A woman expresses thanks for participation, and a man responds with gratitude. Then, the clip transitions into music, featuring a gentle, mellow instrumental piece. The style is reminiscent of a ballad, and the primary instruments are stringed, possibly a harp, creating a contemplative mood.
